contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Kawashima'''|川島町|Kawashima-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Oe District, Tokushima|Oe District]], [[Tokushima Prefecture|Tokushima]], [[Japan]]. On October 1, 2004 Kawashima was merged with the towns of [[Kamojima, Tokushima|Kamojima]] and [[Yamakawa, Tokushima|Yamakawa]], and the village of [[Misato, Tokushima|Misato]], all from [[Oe District, Tokushima|Oe District]], to form the new city of [[Yoshinogawa, Tokushima|Yoshinogawa]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 8,484 and a [[population density]] of 479.59 persons per km². The total area was 17.69 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city.yoshinogawa.lg.jp/ Yoshinogawa official website] {{ja icon}} {{Tokushima-geo-stub}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Tokushima Prefecture]]
